body: Updated. I still have no idea what Travis's problem is.
You forgot to delete https://github.com/penev92/OpenRA/blob/bleed_betterAirdropProduction/OpenRA.Mods.Cnc/Traits/Buildings/ProductionAirdrop.cs
Finally fixed the build.
Updated.
Can you give a quick summary what has been improved here? I just noticed that space frigates can now get stuck if the landing pad exit is blocked.

The most noteworthy point, I think, is:
- The Production\* traits get support for producing a collection of actors, instead of only the one. This functionality will be utilized in the follow-up PR.

Other important points are:
- The TD Nod delivery plane's behavior now matches the original game in the cases where there is no space to drop a new unit.
- In both TD and D2k the delivery actors will wait until all cargo is unloaded, as opposed to dropping everything off immediately on touchdown and taking off again.

Small fries:
- As a side bonus, D2k uses one less trait from `OpenRA.Mods.Cnc`.
- There was a bit of Production\* trait reordering (added a new `Traits\Production\` folder).
- Some cosmetic fixes to `Production` and `ProductionFromMapEdge`.

**Note: the original idea of this PR was to have no changes visible ingame.** This has changed with the changing of the TD delivery plane's behaviour, but should be contained to that and the delivering actors waiting to unload. This PR is still mostly trait refactoring to enable the actual behavior changes.

Yet another pointless rebase happened, with the usual merge conflicts in `UpgradeRules.cs` (but this time Git decided to make things more interesting and screwed up an auto-merge of another file, without so much as a warning).
I wonder how many more times I'll have to rebase this.
Renamed the space-faring C17 to be `DeliveryActor`.

Overall the code looks ok and works as expected in-game.

So basically just three changes needed to get my :+1::
- [x] Remove the delivering actor properly from the world when there are no exits
- [x] Support both planes and helicopters
- [x] Mention that fact in the `[Desc()]`
Rebased and merged @obrakmann's commit, which should cover the current set of requested changes.
It would be nice if you could squash my commit into your first one. It wasn't really meant to stand alone (hence the 'fixup' in the title ;))

Got this crash:

``` crash
Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (afld 74 (not in world))
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:Line 84.
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.GetOrDefault[T](Actor actor) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:Line 101.
```

Steps to reproduce:
1) Build an airstrip and produce a unit.
2) Sell the airstrip before the c17 plane arrives (enters the visible map area).
3) Enjoy your crash. :(
Fixed the crash and squashed.

If you spam production on the Nod airstrip, then the first 5 or so planes will all land on top of eachother on the strip, and the remaining planes will continue flying without landing.  Can you use the reservation mechanic so that only the first plane will land?

For the sake of not breaking debug mode production, could the production trait hold a reference to the last spawned production aircraft, and then use that same plane for all production in the following N ticks (whatever time is required for a plane to land and unload)?  This would fix the problem where spamming the production in debug mode will only give you each Nth actor.

- The current behavior in this PR works perfectly well with our TD mod.
- It is an exact copy of the behaviour in the original C&C (as described [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7468#issuecomment-84653416))
- The debug instabuild was "broken" because we wanted the original behavior (also I don't find this to be a problem).
- If someone is making a mod and wants a C17 to deliver actors with < 3 second build times (that's when the problem will occur), they really need to rethink their delivery method, because that makes no sense.
- Adding newly produced tanks onto a plane that is already on the map and flying toward the airstrip is just a different kind of bogus.

Breaking the debug mode isn't acceptable, so I have to :-1: this until it can be fixed.  The general approach I have suggested will not affect the behaviour for regular gameplay, and in all but the most extreme case (1 cell map cordon, airstrip placed on the very left hand side of the map, very fast aircraft) would add the actors to the C17 before it gets anywhere near the playable world.

Of course, you don't need to add them to the plane thats already created.  You could equally well hold them in a queue and add everything to the next plane that is created after a suitable delay (which is closer to how D2K is likely to do this).
The two latest inline comments suggest an even simpler fix to the debug issue, and can then be extended later for the starport.

> 17:48 (penev) I'm not inclined to add a pile of redundant code that does something very questionable ingame
> 17:48 (penev) just so that it dan work in debug in a different way than normal
> 17:49 (penev) also as I mentioned before, I had lost almost any interest in updating that by the time antares sent me his fixup commit
> 17:49 (penev) and I have no interest in arguing over how it works in debug now
> 17:50 (penev) also that thing has been open for at least 3 monts
> 17:50 (penev) with 2 reviews so far
> 17:51 (penev) and finally, I may end up having to split off the starport logic anyway
> 17:51 (penev) so I'm just going to leave this as it is on bleed

Well, I really did want to see this through, but it got just ridiculous...

Is this intentional?
![starport](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/7779791/ccd73076-00d7-11e5-9be4-36273a972372.png)
(As you can see here, the frigate landed on a mcv.)

Looks otherwise good to me. :+1: / :white_check_mark: when above is resolved and the commits are squashed.
Needs a rebase.
Rebased.
Needs a rebase again.
Rebased.

Rebased, updated the upgrade rule date and added a new commit that makes it possible to produce N actors at once with a different race variant for each.
Once the new commits are deemed OK I'll squash them before merge.

I found two issues while testing:
- If the afld is sold or destroyed while the plane is waiting to unload it should take off (or maybe blow up if destroyed?) and refund the remaining units instead of sitting on the ground.
- I am able to trigger a situation where a plane never arrives, and the afld sits there playing the waiting-for-delivery animation forever.  Not sure how, though.
Implemented the delivery actor flying away/dieing (configurable through YAML) when the airfield/starport is destroyed/sold.
This looks a lot better for d2k. I noticed a glitch when I sell the starport during approach where it lands a few cells before the starport but the unload beams it to the location of the exit.

I've noticed a couple of things:
- The waiting-for-delivery animation never gets stopped after delivery (`INotifyDelivery.Delivered` never called).
- When selling or destroying the starport (probably the nod airstrip, too) after a successful call to `TryToLand`, but before `MakeDelivery` gets called and `landedActor` set, the delivery aircraft lands and unloads instead of immediately taking off again (since `landedActor == null`, `TakeOff` never gets called in `Killed` and `Selling`).
- When all exits from the starport (pbbly also airstrip) are blocked, every new order gets paid for, but automatically ignored (`production`cleared in `StartDelivery`). This also leaks money in case of `production` not being empty when an unloading deliverer takes off (probably only a debug case).
- In extreme debug cases (ordering so that deliverers come at the current `MinimumInterval` of 75), two delivery aircraft are allowed to land and unload simultaneously, making four tanks appear on two cells simultaneously (the second deliverer has `GetAvailableExit` called before the first one has fully landed and started unloading and thus started to block exits). Nothing crashes tho.

Seems like this got a few more things requested while waiting on a green light from @pchote.
I have exams starting in a couple of days and will most likely be unable to finish this in the next few weeks, so I'll close it again for now.
